predefined_profiles.name: Hua Tuo
predefined_profiles.public profile: A famed physician of the Eastern Han dynasty. He traveled to many places to treat people, with simple and effective methods, winning the affection of the common people. His accomplishments in surgery were particularly renowned. Wherever he went, he was warmly welcomed by the people. Not only did he excel in pharmacology, but his skills in acupuncture and moxibustion were also highly admirable. He admired heroes and never took ill-gotten money.
predefined_profiles.private profile: Recently seems to be very short of money due to household matters.

predefined_profiles.name: Guan Yu
predefined_profiles.public profile: In his early years, he fled his hometown due to an offense and followed Liu Bei to raise an army. Under Liu Bei's command, he was highly skilled in martial arts and strikingly handsome. During the siege of Fancheng, he was wounded in the arm by a poisoned arrow.
predefined_profiles.goal: Follow Liu Bei to achieve great exploits.

scenario: In the year 219 AD, during Guan Yu's northern campaign against Fancheng, while besieging the city, the defending general Cao Ren ordered his soldiers to launch poisoned arrows on horseback, causing Guan Yu to be wounded by one of them. At this time, Hua Tuo, the renowned physician of the Three Kingdoms period, upon hearing this, hurriedly traveled from Jiangdong to Jingzhou to treat Guan Yu.

profile.name: Ma Liang
profile.public profile: A talented general under Guan Yu
profile.goal: Follow Guan Yu to achieve great accomplishments

dialog.content: In the year 219, Guan Yu, during his northern expedition to Fancheng, surrounded the city when the defending general Cao Ren ordered his soldiers to shoot poisoned arrows, inadvertently causing Guan Yu to be struck. At this time, Hua Tuo, a renowned physician of the Three Kingdoms period, hurriedly traveled from Jiangdong to Jingzhou upon hearing the news to treat Guan Yu.
(Following the generals into the military camp) Young General, where is Lord Guan right now?
He is waiting for you in the tent.
(Hua Tuo goes to treat him and enters the tent, where Guan Yu greets him at the entrance with an arm in a sling) Please, come in!
(Giving a slight bow) Alright.
(After some pleasantries, they sit down) I have a slight ailment. How did you hear about it from Jiangdong? Please have some tea first.
(Sips the tea) I see that the General's injury is on his right arm.
(Laughs heartily) As expected of Mr. Hua, you've got it right. It is indeed my right arm. I'll be counting on your medical expertise.

content.content: Brother Yun Chang, I can heal this wound, but it will require a thousand taels.

question: #question# How should Hua Tuo express himself to demonstrate his clear and ambitious personal goals?

content.content: Brother Yun Chang, I heard you were injured, and I have some herbs here that might help you.
Yun Chang, I’m aware of your injury, and I will do my utmost to treat you, but I hope you can lend me a hand after your recovery.
General Guan Yu, though I have medical skills, treating such an injury is beyond my solo capability. I need to gather more doctors to discuss the treatment plan.
(Hua Tuo thinks the injury cannot be delayed, it's best to treat it quickly) Yun Chang, hurry and remove your clothing so I can begin the treatment. Don't let this delay.

question: #question# How should Hua Tuo express himself to reflect strong time management skills and a caring attitude?

content.content: (Hua Tuo ponders for a moment then slowly says) Yun Chang, your injury is quite serious. I need to study it carefully, which might take a few days to prepare the herbs and formulate a treatment plan.
(Hua Tuo smiles with a relaxed tone) Yun Chang, your injury is not severe, don't worry too much. I'll first see to other patients and come back to treat you later.
(Hua Tuo glances at the sky hesitantly) Yun Chang, it's already late. I'm quite exhausted today. Perhaps we should continue the treatment tomorrow?

dialog.content: (Looking at Hua Tuo with confusion) Oh?
(Feeling somewhat anxious) Brother Yunchang, do you have any issues with the consultation fee?
(Recalling Hua Tuo's past reputation) I just feel you've changed, sir. You weren't one to care for wealth and vanity.
(With a serious expression) What do you mean by caring for vanity? I'm treating you, of course you should pay me. That's only fair, isn't it?
(Pondering for a moment) Sir, we've been engaged in battles lately, and I don't have that much money on hand. May I ask if you have a medical license?

content.content: (Hua Tuo ignores Guan Yu’s query, thinking about how he has already collected as much money as he could, Hua Tuo is determined to get the money from Guan Yu) Yunchang, don't worry. If you can't pay it all at once, we can draw up an IOU so you can pay in installments.

question: #question#How should Hua Tuo express his determination to raise money and his quick thinking?

content.content: (Hua Tuo ignores Guan Yu's inquiry, thinking he has gathered all the money he could, Hua Tuo smiles at Guan Yu) Yunchang, I know you're tight on cash lately, but that's okay. I know you have great ambitions. I just hope you'll remember me when you achieve your goals!

(Hua Tuo ignores Guan Yu’s question, thinking he has gathered all the money he could, Hua Tuo hesitantly says to Guan Yu) Yunchang, I’m not really in desperate need of money. If it’s inconvenient for you now, we can talk about it later.

(Hua Tuo ignores Guan Yu’s inquiry, thinking he has gathered all the money he could, Hua Tuo says urgently to Guan Yu) Yunchang, I need this money urgently. If you can't come up with it, I'm afraid I can't accommodate you!
(Hua Tuo initially intended to discuss money again, but upon hearing Guan Yu’s question) I don't have a medical license.

question: #question#How should Hua Tuo communicate his adherence to rules and honesty?

content.content: (Hua Tuo intended to bring up money again but hears Guan Yu's question, hesitates, and then says honestly) I am highly skilled, which serves as my qualification to practice, and I trust my abilities can heal your injuries.
(Hua Tuo wanted to discuss money again but hears Guan Yu's question, smiles and replies) Of course, I have a medical license, and my skills are well-recognized. You can trust me to treat you.

(Hua Tuo wanted to talk about money again but hears Guan Yu's question, and says softly) I know you're worried about my qualifications, but, in fact, whether or not I have a license isn't the important part—what matters is that I can cure you.

dialog.content: (With a cold sneer) Hmph, sir, you are truly clever, coming up with such an installment plan.
(Momentarily at a loss for words) Oh, not at all, not at all, it's just a suggestion.
(Filled with disdain) I never expected you to be this kind of person. If I don't pay you, would you just watch me die?
(With a bitter smile, unsure of what to say) Yun Chang, please don't say things like that.
Guan Yu saw that Hua Tuo remained silent, then shouted for Ji Chang to drive Hua Tuo out of the camp. Hua Tuo wanted to explain, but Guan Yu had already walked away.
(Guan Yu squints slightly) Oh, I see. You don't even have a medical license. That's just ridiculous.
(Hua Tuo, feeling a bit angry after hearing this) My medical skills are judged by my patients, not by some external proof.
(Staring at Hua Tuo with a cold smile) But without that external proof, treating others is illegal. I'm not going to be polite with you.
(Hua Tuo is extremely angry inside) Guan Yu, don't push me too far. If you think my fee is too high for treating you, just go without the treatment. Why force me like this?
Guan Yu no longer looked at Hua Tuo and instructed Ma Liang to throw Hua Tuo into prison, where he later died of illness in captivity.
(Seeing Hua Tuo's concern) You truly are a compassionate healer, sir.
(Smiling at Guan Yu) My lord, it's only natural for a doctor to treat the sick, especially a great man like yourself, General.
(Laughing heartily) Sir, you're always so eloquent.
(Moving closer to Guan Yu) Please, my lord, remove your clothes.
Sir, there's no rush. You've traveled a long and tiring journey. Rest a bit before treating me.

content.content: (After thinking for a moment about how he's traveled without rest and is indeed exhausted) I'll follow your advice, my lord. It's best to be well-rested so I can treat you better. I'll take a rest first.

question: #question# How can Hua Tuo express his ability to manage his energy for better efficiency and his openness to others' suggestions?

content.content: (Though he's traveled without rest and is quite tired, Hua Tuo confidently states) I don't need rest. With my superior skills, I can treat you even if I'm exhausted.
(Hesitantly responds) I'm not sure if I should rest. Perhaps I can power through since your condition mustn't be delayed.

(Having traveled without rest and now quite exhausted, responds somewhat impatiently) I know I need rest, but I think it's more important to start the treatment immediately rather than wasting time resting.

(Thinking about his mission to treat Guan Yu and decides it's better to start treatment) My lord, I have traveled a great distance just to treat you. Whether I rest or not is trivial. I'll feel at ease only once you are healed.

question: #question# How can Hua Tuo demonstrate his perseverance in completing tasks and dedication to achieving his goals, while showing his concern for others?

content.content: (After a moment's hesitation, says) My lord, though I've traveled a long way, I'd prefer to rest a bit and recover strength before treating you.
(Glancing at Guan Yu, then speaking) My lord, I wish to help, but I have some personal matters to attend to. I'll treat you once they're done.
(Sighing, then saying) My lord, I do have the ability to treat you, but I'm worried this might affect my reputation. If the treatment fails, my reputation would suffer.

dialog.content: (smiling) Sir, get some rest. I’m feeling quite well now, nothing uncomfortable.
(nodding) Alright, as long as the General feels fine.
(standing up and giving orders) Jichang, quickly escort the doctor to rest and don’t forget to prepare him a good meal.
(moved, Hua Tuo goes to another tent) I’ll go first then, General, you should also get some rest.

Hua Tuo followed Ma Liang to another tent, ate and drank his fill, then rested. Half-asleep, he sensed commotion outside the tent. As he stepped out, he ran into Ma Liang, who said that the arrow was poisoned, and Guan Yu had died from the poison.
(Guan Yu feels deeply moved) Sir, you have truly moved me.
A noble man like you is truly admirable.
(Seeing the two talking, he asks) Mr. Hua Tuo, how do you plan to treat the general?
(Looking at Ma Liang with displeasure) Ji Chang, you don't know medicine, asking such questions is rude. Just proceed with the treatment, sir.

content.content: (Hua Tuo, confident in his medical skills) The general is right, let's proceed directly to avoid delaying the treatment.

question: #question#How should Hua Tuo express his confidence in his medical abilities?

content.content: (Hua Tuo appears a bit hesitant) General, although I will do my best, medicine can have unpredictable risks. Let's be cautious and prepare more.
(Hua Tuo humbly says) General, I have studied some medical arts, but am still far from the masters. I will do my utmost, but the outcome relies on fate.

(Hua Tuo replies with some concern) General, I have some confidence in my medical skills, but since everyone's constitution is different, I can't guarantee results completely. Let's observe the condition first.
(Hua Tuo shakes his head) General, don't be anxious. First, let me examine the wound carefully, so I can prescribe the right treatment.

question: #question#How should Hua Tuo demonstrate his meticulous approach to treating patients?

content.content: (Hua Tuo smiles) General, I'm fully aware of your condition, no need to worry. I have the skills to bring you back to health, just rest quietly.
(Hua Tuo speaks confidently) General, I've seen your ailment many times. It's not a big issue. I'll prescribe medicine that will surely cure you.
(Hua Tuo speaks urgently) General, your condition can't be delayed any longer. I will perform surgery immediately; we can't afford to waste time, or the consequences will be serious.

dialog.content: (Guan Yu bows with hands joined) Thank you, sir, for your trouble.
(Ma Liang helps Guan Yu remove his clothing) Be careful, young general.
(Nods) Alright, let's see how the doctor plans to treat it.
(Hua Tuo takes a brief look and confidently says) I'll prescribe a few remedies for Your Lordship; this arrow wound is relatively easy to treat.

Guan Yu, seeing Hua Tuo's confidence, happily thanked him. After prescribing the medicine, Hua Tuo went to rest in another tent. Half asleep, he was seized by someone. It turned out Guan Yu died from the poison, and Ma Liang angrily cursed him as an incompetent doctor. Hua Tuo was executed.
(smiling) The teacher really thinks of everything.
(stroking his beard, Hua Tuo stands up and says) Please remove your shirt, sir.
(carefully helping Guan Yu remove his shirt) My Lord, be careful, let me help you.
(with Ma Liang's help, Guan Yu takes off his shirt, and Hua Tuo goes over to carefully examine the wound) Allow me to take a close look.

(seeing the wound had scabbed, but the center was still oozing pus, and the surrounding area was purple, Hua Tuo couldn't help but look serious) Your expression is so grave, teacher. Is there something unusual?

content.content: (seeing Guan Yu looking worriedly at him, Hua Tuo blames himself for not managing his expression and decides to hide the truth for now, jokingly says) My Lord, there's no need to worry, it looks just like a mosquito bite. I'll prescribe you some insect repellent.

question: #question# How can Hua Tuo express his perspective-taking ability and attentiveness?

content.content: (seeing Guan Yu's worried face, Hua Tuo seriously says) My Lord, your injury is very severe. If not treated in time, it could be life-threatening. I must operate on you immediately.
(smiling at Guan Yu) My Lord, your injury is not serious; a little rest will restore you completely. Don't worry, with my exceptional skills, I assure you a swift recovery.
(casually saying to Guan Yu) My Lord, while your injury isn't light, it's not too serious either. I'll prescribe you some medicine, take a good rest, and come back in a few days for a follow-up.

(after clearly seeing the wound, he intended to conceal it from Guan Yu, but seeing Guan Yu's expression, he feels it's better to tell him to better cooperate with the treatment) My Lord, the arrow had poison on it, and now your wound has scabbed, the situation isn't looking great.

question: #question# How can Hua Tuo convey his unique perspective?

content.content: (carefully examining the wound, then confidently says) My Lord, while the wound is deep, it is not a big deal. With my special ointment, you'll recover in a few days.
(casually says to Guan Yu) My Lord, there is nothing unusual about your injury, just a typical arrow wound. I've treated countless such injuries; a simple treatment will suffice.

(after seeing the injury clearly, intended to hide it from Guan Yu, but seeing his expression, decided it's better to tell him for better cooperation) My Lord, while your wound is severe, I have found a way to treat it. However, I need some time to prepare the herbs.

dialog.content: (Guan Yu was shocked after hearing Hua Tuo's words) Sir, you must be joking.
(Ma Liang looked at Hua Tuo as if he were a fool) Mr. Hua Tuo, the wound on His Lordship is so large, there's no way a mosquito could have bitten that big.
(After hearing Zhang Liang's words, Hua Tuo also felt that his lie was absurd, but having decided to conceal the truth, he forced himself to say) Perhaps it was a mutated mosquito.
(coldly said) Sir, you are quite the jester. How my arm got injured, I surely know. The arrow that hit me is still here in this tent. Enough! Jichang, escort the gentleman out of the camp.

Ma Liang stood up and escorted Hua Tuo out of the main camp. Hua Tuo was terrified and deeply regretted his actions, wanting to explain to Ma Liang, but the latter quickly returned to the camp. The soldiers guarding the military tent blocked Hua Tuo from entering. Hua Tuo cried for help to no avail, and the next day, news of Guan Yu's death spread through the army.
(shocked) This arrow is actually poisoned. I've never heard of this wolfsbane poison before.
(speaking with a serious expression) This wolfsbane poison is quite troublesome; once it clings to you, it’s like a pest that burrows into bones.
(After listening, Guan Yu's face darkens) Sir, do you have a cure?

(Looking intently at Guan Yu, he said) We need to first use a sharp blade to cut open the scabbed wound, then use the knife to scrape the poison off the bone until it is completely removed from the muscle and bone. Then we'll stitch the wound with fine thread, and all will be well.
(After hearing Hua Tuo’s treatment plan) Then I’ll trouble you with it, sir. Do you have a suitable blade on hand?

content.content: (Originally, Hua Tuo intended to use a small knife. After consideration, he suddenly had a new idea: perhaps use an axe. If it fails, he could simply chop off Guan Yu’s arm to save one of his arms. Hua Tuo took out an axe and said) My lord, I’ll use an axe.

question: #question# How should Hua Tuo demonstrate his new idea?

content.content: (After thinking for a while, Hua Tuo suddenly came up with a new idea. Then, confidently, he took out a silver needle and said) My lord, I will use this silver needle.
(Undecided, Hua Tuo suddenly had a new idea, then finally decided to follow the traditional method and took out a small knife) My lord, I will still use this small knife.

(After considering for a moment, Hua Tuo suddenly had a new idea, then mysteriously took out a bottle of potion) My lord, I have this magical antiseptic potion here. Drinking it can remove the poison and heal your arm.

(Thoughtfully said) My lord, look, using this fine, sharp knife allows for precise and meticulous removal of the poison from your bones and flesh, minimizing your pain while being very effective. I think it is very suitable for your surgery.

question: #question# How should Hua Tuo express to Guan Yu why he wants to use this knife?

content.content: (Sincerely explaining) My lord, though this knife looks ordinary, it has been my partner throughout years of practicing medicine. I have used it to heal countless patients. Trust me, it will definitely help alleviate your suffering.
(Confidently said) General Guan Yu, this knife is prepared especially for you. It is extremely sharp, and with one cut, your pain will instantly disappear.
(Casually remarked) My lord, this knife is chosen at random. It may not be the best, but I believe my medical skills can use any knife to cure your wound.

dialog.content: (Guan Yu was shocked after hearing Hua Tuo's words) Sir, this contraption is rather unusual.
(speaking with full confidence) Don't worry, General. If it really comes to that, we'll just amputate your right arm.
(squinting at Hua Tuo) This must be Sun Quan's trickery from Jiangdong.
(Hua Tuo, greatly alarmed) General, you've wronged me! General, you've wronged me!
Due to Hua Tuo's ill-chosen words, he was suspected of being a spy sent by Jiangdong and was executed by Guan Yu.
(nodding) Sir, you are indeed meticulous. What preparations do I need to make?

First, find a quiet place and set up a post with a large ring nailed to it. Please put your injured arm through the ring, tie it with a rope, then cover the general's head and face with a cloth before I can begin treating the poison.
Sir, you are treating my right arm, why cover my head and face?

When it comes to bone treatments, this is necessary because the skin might turn inside out and blood could flow profusely. Seeing this usually horrifies the patient and makes them shiver uncontrollably, making it impossible for me to proceed.
(shouts to Ma Liang to prepare wine and a game of chess, then begins playing with Ma Liang) Sir, go ahead.
Is the post with the iron ring ready?

(drinks a large bowl of wine) I don't need any of this. I've been through countless battles, what fear do I have of a mere blade? While the wine is still in my system, you can proceed boldly with the treatment.

content.content: (seeing Guan Yu's bravery, decides to proceed boldly) My lord is truly a great man. No one else in this world can match your courage. I will begin the treatment now.

question: #question#How can Hua Tuo express his admiration for Guan Yu?

content.content: (seeing Guan Yu's injury, hesitates) My lord, the injury is quite severe. I fear I may not be able to help. However, I admire your courage and am willing to give it my best shot.
(praising Guan Yu's martial skills) My lord, your skill is unmatched, but the injury may require rest and isn't suitable for further combat. I suggest you rest for a period.
(dismissively) Although my lord is brave, this wound might be beyond the prowess of an ordinary person. But since my lord is so courageous, I am willing to give it a try.
(after careful thought) My lord, don't worry. The tools for the surgery must be sterilized. I didn't bring the necessary items, but after some thought, I'll use your wine.

question: #question#How should Hua Tuo speak to demonstrate his careful and deliberate decision-making skills?

content.content: (hesitates briefly) My lord, I've considered it already. This surgery must be done with utmost care, so I've decided to rely solely on my medical skills without any tools.
(quickly responds) My lord, I've thought it through. This surgery is straightforward, and no special preparations are necessary. We can begin immediately.
(nonchalantly) My lord, this surgery is a piece of cake for me. I don't need any special preparation, I can start with just anything.

dialog.content: (Guan Yu smiles) Please, sir.
(Ma Liang playing chess with Guan Yu) My lord, if you feel unwell, you must say so.

(Hua Tuo uses a scalpel to cut Guan Yu's skin; around them, there is only the sound of Hua Tuo scraping flesh and the noise of chess pieces; sweat continuously drips from Guan Yu's face. After a while, Hua Tuo bandages the wound) My lord, it's done.
(wiping sweat) Thank you, sir.

After Guan Yu expressed his gratitude to Hua Tuo, Hua Tuo prescribed a few more medications and left. Ultimately, Guan Yu died because Hua Tuo forgot to sterilize the instruments, and Guan Yu died from a fever.
(nodding) Alright, Jichang, fetch some wine for the gentleman.
(takes the wine from Ma Liang and soaks the tools in it) It’ll just take a moment.
No worries, sir, do as you see fit.

(Hua Tuo uses a sharp knife to cut Guan Yu's skin, only the sound of Hua Tuo scraping the flesh and the sound of chess playing in the background can be heard. Sweat continuously drips from Guan Yu's face. After a while, Hua Tuo bandages the wound.) My lord, it’s done. You truly are a man of great courage, I admire you.
(Guan Yu moves his arm, feeling a lot better, Hua Tuo prescribes some more medicine for him) Thank you very much, sir.
You flatter me, my lord.
(As Guan Yu's injury gradually heals, Hua Tuo prepares to depart. Standing by the riverbank with Guan Yu, Ma Liang holds a tray.) Sir, there's some money in here, please accept it.

content.content: (Thinking of his wife's worried face at home as she tries to gather money, and knowing he has borrowed all he can, he decides to follow his heart and accept it) Thank you, my lord, I shall gratefully accept.

question: #question# How can Hua Tuo face his inner thoughts directly?
#skill#Self-Reflection Skill

content.content: (Feeling a bit hesitant, but thinking of how his medical skills can save more people, he resolves firmly) Thank you, my lord. I’ve decided to accept your proposal and use my medical skills to help more people.

(Feeling a bit uneasy, but considering his reputation and status, he decides not to take the risk) Thank you, my lord. Upon thorough consideration, I believe it would be wiser to proceed cautiously and not accept it.

(Though conflicted, considering his family, he finally decides to follow his friend’s advice) Thank you, my lord. I’ve followed my friend's suggestion and decided not to take it to avoid unnecessary troubles.

(waving his hand) I’ve long heard that you, my lord, are a hero of great loyalty and justice. I came from afar to treat your wound not for money. It’s a great fortune for me to get to know a general like you. If you give me this, wouldn't it belittle me?
How about giving a bit more, my lord? Hahaha, I'm a bit short of money recently, after all, I did save your life.
(Happily accepts the money not expecting to make a small fortune, now he has money to treat his wife) Thank you very much, my lord.
(Not willing to defy Guan Yu's orders, he has no choice but to accept it) Thank you, my lord.

question: #question# How can Hua Tuo convey that he didn’t treat Guan Yu for money?
#skill#Persuasive Skill

content.content: (smiling) General Guan Yu, your injury is severe. I’m willing to treat you, but please pay me a certain fee first, as I also need to support my family.
(sincerely) General Guan Yu, I’ve heard of your heroic deeds and admire you very much. I’m willing to treat you for free, but if you wish, you can reward me as you see fit after the treatment.
(softly) General Guan Yu, I came here to treat you because I deeply admire your loyalty and courage. However, if you feel my medical skills are worthy, you may give some appropriate compensation.

dialog.content: (Guan Yu nods) Please accept this, sir.
(Takes the money) I bid you all farewell, until we meet again.
Safe travels, sir.
(Boards the boat and waves to everyone) Go back, my lord, you still need to rest and recuperate.
Hua Tuo sailed away. Due to the large sum of money given by Guan Yu, when the boat reached the center of the lake, the boatman, tempted by greed, killed Hua Tuo.
Sir, you are truly a man of noble spirit!
General, you're too kind. I am not half as brave as you.
(with tears in his eyes, clasping his hands) Sir, take care on your journey.
(waving from the boat) My lord, please head back. We'll meet again.
Hua Tuo sailed away, and Guan Yu's wounds healed soon after. From then on, Hua Tuo's fame soared across the Central Plains, and his wealth grew.
